info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 21 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Poinsett and Cross Counties through 345 AM CDT... At 259 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Algoa, or 12 miles southeast of Newport, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wynne, Cherry Valley, Hickory Ridge, Waldenburg, Vanndale, Fisher, Wiley Crossing, Birdeye, Pittinger, Supply, Mersman, Fair Field, Bay Village and Monterey. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
